description: HairClub seeks to be the trusted leader in total hair solutions for all, helping people discover their true confidence and achieve their goals. The Supply Chain Analyst primary organizing and monitoring supply and demand of inventories. Provides analysis and manages the entire inventories and order cycles to enhance business development and ensure sustainability and stake holder satisfaction, both internally and externally.
responsibilities:
Ensure reliable, accurate and accessible product stock keeping unit (“SKU”) data that drive corporate-wide processes
Develop and maintain reports including but not limited to out of stock, inventory aging, forecast accuracy, days on hand and inventory turn
Utilize data mining discovery techniques and search for insights to uncover key business drivers
Research and troubleshoot problems and questions related to deployed analytic solutions
Perform all required analytics pertaining to inventory supply and demand; oversee procurement including but not limited to consumption levels and product life cycle. Develop and report key performance indicators (“KPI’s”) related to Inventory Levels, Values, COG’s for quarterly review.
Analyzes and forecasts inventory levels for purchasing needs 
Perform other related duties as assigned
Work with Operations, Product Development, Procurement, Distribution Center and Finance to identify areas of opportunity
Supports Center audits by maintaining and updating processes, reports, findings, documentation, and ensure proper data entry as well as working on individual center audits to look for growth opportunities
Supports the Corporate Operations Department in various projects including but not limited to one time or recurring analytical information and findings/proposals.

qualifications.required:
4-6 years relevant experience
Degree in Operations and/in Supply Chain Management and Analytics
Excellent Microsoft Office Suite skills, especially Word and Excel
Experience with Operations, Procurement, Compliance and/or project management preferred
Strong analytical skills and use a fact-based/data driven approach to drive continuous improvement
Solid understanding of data quality issues and provide recommendations for ensuring/validating data quality
Understands data modeling and data management
Ability to work under pressure and handle multiple priorities
Attention to detail

benefits: Paid paternity leave, Vision insurance, Dental insurance, 401(k), Paid maternity leave, Medical insurance, Disability insurance
